text:
Hello Folks,
I am going to use HubSpot data in Power BI, by building some reports for Deal, Companies and Contacts objects.
It seems there is no power BI connector for HubSpot. Instead, I will use HubSpot API to Pull up the HubSpot data to server/local computer, then process and import the data to Power BI to build reports. Is this good idea or is there better idea somewhere that I am not aware of?

Hello.
If someone ever used "Reverse Proxy with HubSpot" (<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/developer-reference/reverse-proxy-support>) service - did you met any issues (like rate-limits/etc.) with it? Except incorrect "IP Source" selection (it seems known/unresolved issue).
Thanks.
The rate limits are pretty high. Still, we donâ€™t recommend using a single server as the reverse proxy host. Instead use another CDN or something like Cloudfront

HI,

How can i change the date picker of a form?
Anyone here use the Calendly/HubSpot integration (or alternative Calendly integration like via Zapier)? I have a client looking to go that route and just doing some research.

I'm new to HubSpot and found the forms offerings quite confusing. I wanted to have form data on a website go into HubSpot. Firstly I came across the form builder but to have truly custom, raw HTML and CSS forms with that requires the Marketing Pro Plan ("Set as raw HTML form" switch under "Style & preview" tab), but later I found the developer API Forms API that (at least the legacy API) allows external raw HTML and CSS forms to submit data to HubSpot on ANY account, including the free account. What's the difference here? Is the legacy API going to be phased out?
I found it hard to capture the formsubmission conversion id after the form is submitted. can anyone suggest a better way?
